qa.question: What documents are required to be produced at the time of Management Merit admission?
qa.answer: Print out of the Management Merit Application Form, Mark – List of the qualifying examination (Original compulsory and 2 copies), Pass-Certificate of the qualifying examination( If issued by the Board ), SSLC/10th Std. Certificate for age proof (Original compulsory and 2 copies), Admit Card of KEAM 2025/JEE2025 (2 copies), Data Sheet of KEAM 2025 (if it is not published in CEE candidate portal produce Score sheet of KEAM 2025) / Score card of JEE2025 (2 copies), Transfer Certificate (Original compulsory), Conduct Certificate from the Institution last attended, Eligibility Certificate (not required for Kerala HSE, VHSE, CBSE and ISC), Equivalency Certificate from Association of Indian Universities (If the qualifying exam is of any overseas Board ), Community Certificate (from Village Officer for those are eligible for availing the relaxation in qualifying marks in subjects under SC/ST category , and from Parish Priest for Christians), Three recent Passport size photographs, Migration Certificate, Medical Fitness Certificate, College First Year Fee Remittance Receipt

qa.question: Which entrance exams are accepted for B.Tech admissions?
qa.answer: Candidates should qualify in the Engineering Entrance Exam, KEAM 2025, conducted by Commissioner for Entrance Exams, Govt. of Kerala /JEE 2025.

qa.question: What is the minimum age requirement for B.Tech admission?
qa.answer: Applicants should have completed 17 years of age on 31st December 2025. No relaxation of age will be allowed.

qa.question: How will the Management quota merit seats be filled?
qa.answer: As per the order no: ASC 100/21/B.Tech/KCECMA dt 3rd Aug 2021 from the Admission Supervisory Committee for Professional Colleges in Kerala, the Management quota merit seats have three categories – Open, Christian and NRI

qa.question: What are the B.Tech programmes offered and how many seats are available in each?

qa.question: What is the main purpose of the Department Advisory Board (DAB)?
qa.answer: The Departmental Advisory Board (DAB) has been framed with the objective of remaining up to date with the latest requirements of the industry and incorporating necessary components in the curriculum as much as possible.

qa.question: What are some of the responsibilities of the DAB?
qa.answer: The committee develops and recommends new or revised goals and objectives of the programme. The committee also reviews and analyzes the gap between curriculum and Industry requirements and gives necessary feedback or advice actions.

qa.question: Who are the members of the DAB composed of?
qa.answer: The DAB is composed of members from eminent institutions as well as members from industry, alumni and members of faculty of the department.

qa.question: Where is the Electric Vehicle Research Lab located?
Who is the Faculty-in-charge of the Electronic Devices and Circuits Lab?
What is the main purpose of the Analog Electronic Circuits Lab?
qa.answer: The purpose of this lab is for familiarizing basic concepts of Engineering Circuit Analysis, and to illustrate and reinforce these concepts and provide hands-on experience to the students.

qa.question: What kind of equipment is found in the Circuits and Measurements Lab?
qa.answer: The Circuits and Measurement Lab provides thorough knowledge for students regarding various transducers and instrumentation trainers, resistive, capacitive and inductive measurement systems, LVDTs and strain gauges, thermocouples and RTDs, Spot deflection Galvanometer, Weins Bridge Oscillator and Wheatstone Bridge. The lab also contains many basic electrical variables and time measurement equipments such as Frequency Counters, Digital Stopwatches, Digital Multimeters, Digital Anemometer, Digital Earth Tester, Electronic Energy Meter and Digital Oscilloscopes.

qa.question: Who is the Staff-in-charge of the Digital Electronics Lab?
What kind of machines are in the Electrical Machines Lab?
qa.answer: The Electrical Machines Laboratory is equipped with over 20 branded AC machines (single phase and three phase Transformers, Induction machines and Synchronous machines) and DC machines, including programmable V/f controllers, Eddy-current dynamo-motor, industrial type synchronizing panel, etc.

qa.question: What are Programme Educational Objectives (PEOs)?
qa.answer: Programme Educational Objectives are the broad statements which describe in detail about the career and professional accomplishments after significant years of graduation, which the programme prepares the graduands to achieve.

qa.question: What are Programme Outcomes (POs)?
qa.answer: Programme Outcomes are the statements as stated by NBA that declare the knowledge, skills and attitudes the students should have at the end of a four year engineering programme in India.

qa.question: What are Programme Specific Outcomes (PSOs)?
qa.answer: Programme Specific Outcomes are the statements that assert what the graduands of a specific engineering programme should be able to do.

qa.question: What should Engineering graduates be able to do, according to Programme Outcomes?
qa.answer: Engineering graduates will be able to: Apply the knowledge of mathematics, science, engineering fundamentals, and an engineering specialization to the solution of complex engineering problems.

qa.question: What is the vision of the Electrical & Electronics Engineering Department?
qa.answer: To be a Centre of Excellence in Electrical & Electronics Engineering Education, Research and Application of knowledge to benefit the society at large.

qa.question: What is the mission of the Electrical & Electronics Engineering Department?
qa.answer: To mould quality Electrical Engineers, fostering creativity and innovation to address global issues.

qa.question: What are graduates of Electrical and Electronics Engineering expected to do as one of the programme specific outcomes?
qa.answer: To apply the knowledge in Electrical and Electronics Engineering for the design of Power Generation, Transmission, Distribution and Utilization systems.

qa.question: What are graduates of Electrical and Computer Engineering expected to do as one of the programme specific outcomes?
qa.answer: To apply the knowledge in Electrical Engineering and Computer Engineering for the design, development testing and operation of Power and Energy Systems in the areas of Generation, Transmission, Conversion, Distribution and Utilization systems.

qa.question: What areas of expertise do the faculty members have?
qa.answer: The faculty members have expertise in core areas of Electronics Engineering such as DSP, Microprocessors, VLSI Engineering, and Image Processing.

qa.question: What are the faculty members involved in besides teaching?
qa.answer: In addition to teaching, the Faculty Members are involved in R&D activities and in guiding the Doctoral Programs of research scholars from nearby academic and R& D institutions.

qa.question: What are PEOs?
qa.answer: PEOs are broad statements that describe the career and professional accomplishments that the programme is preparing the graduates to accomplish.

qa.question: What will graduates of the program be able to do regarding industry and academia?
qa.answer: They will be able to adapt to the changing needs of Industry and Academia through continuous learning and professional upgrading.

qa.question: What are POs?
qa.answer: POs describe what students will be able to do at the end of the programme. POs are to be specific, measurable and achievable.

qa.question: What kind of knowledge will engineering graduates apply?
qa.answer: Apply the knowledge of mathematics, science, engineering fundamentals, and an engineering specialization to the solution of complex engineering problems.

qa.question: What's one Programme Specific Outcome?
qa.answer: Design Electronic Circuits and Systems for Communication, Monitoring and Control Applications.

qa.question: What is the department's vision?
qa.answer: To be a Centre of Excellence in Electronics and Communication Engineering Education and Research for the service of humanity.

qa.question: What is the department's mission?
qa.answer: To provide quality Engineering Education and to carry out Research in the field of Electronics and Communication Engineering addressing the challenges faced by the society.

qa.question: What should graduates consider when designing solutions for complex engineering problems?
qa.answer: Appropriate consideration for the public health and safety, and the cultural, societal, and environmental considerations.

qa.question: What are the key elements of Problem Analysis?
qa.answer: Identify, formulate, review research literature, and analyze complex engineering problems reaching substantiated conclusions using first principles of mathematics, natural sciences, and engineering sciences.

qa.question: What are the elements of 'Modern tool usage'?
qa.answer: Create, select, and apply appropriate techniques, resources, and modern engineering and IT tools including prediction and modeling to complex engineering activities with an understanding of the limitations.

qa.question: What are the three key areas in which graduates will be engaged?
qa.answer: Graduates will be Engineering Professionals, Innovators or Entrepreneurs engaged in Technology Development or implementation of Engineering Systems meeting the Industrial needs.

qa.answer: To be a Centre of Excellence in Education and Research, imparting ethical values for the betterment of mankind.

qa.question: What are Engineering Graduates expected to be able to apply knowledge to?
qa.answer: Apply the knowledge of mathematics, science, engineering fundamentals, and an engineering specialization to the solution of complex engineering problems.

qa.question: Name one Programme Specific Outcome (PSO) for this B.Tech program.
qa.answer: Apply the concepts of Solid Mechanics in the design of Mechanical Engineering systems.

qa.question: What is one aspect of 'Problem analysis' that Engineering Graduates should be able to do?
qa.answer: Identify, formulate, review research literature, and analyze complex engineering problems reaching substantiated conclusions using first principles of mathematics, natural sciences, and engineering sciences.

qa.question: What is one aspect of 'Design/development of solutions' that Engineering Graduates should consider?
qa.answer: Appropriate consideration for the public health and safety, and the cultural, societal, and environmental considerations.

qa.question: What is one aspect of 'Modern tool usage' that Engineering Graduates should demonstrate?
qa.answer: Create, select, and apply appropriate techniques, resources, and modern engineering and IT tools including prediction and modeling to complex engineering activities with an understanding of the limitations.

qa.question: What is one aspect of 'Ethics' that Engineering Graduates should do?
qa.answer: Apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics and responsibilities and norms of the engineering practice.

qa.question: What is one aspect of 'Communication' that Engineering Graduates should be able to do?
qa.answer: Communicate effectively on complex engineering activities with the engineering community and with society at large, such as, being able to comprehend and write effective reports and design documentation, make effective presentations, and give and receive clear instructions.

qa.question: What is one area of knowledge to be demonstrated under the 'Project management and finance' outcome?
qa.answer: Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the engineering and management principles and apply these to one’s own work, as a member and leader in a team, to manage projects and in multidisciplinary environments.

qa.question: What is one aspect of 'Life-long learning' that Engineering Graduates should do?
qa.answer: Recognize the need for, and have the preparation and ability to engage in independent and life-long learning in the broadest context of technological change.

qa.question: What kind of instruments are available in the Physics Lab?
qa.answer: The laboratory includes sophisticated & advanced instruments like spectrometers, travelling microscopes, diode Lasers etc.

qa.question: What areas of physics do the lab experiments cover?
qa.answer: The Engineering Physics laboratory is well equipped with modern & advanced instruments for conducting lab experiments in various important areas of physics like optics, mechanics, electronics & electricity.

qa.question: What does the Engineering Physics lab help students with?
qa.answer: The laboratory of Engineering Physics brings the student into contact with activity in several technical subjects like Optics, mechanics, circuit analysis, electromagnetic fields etc., which drives the students to various technical areas.

qa.question: What kind of experiments can be performed in the Chemistry Lab?
qa.answer: The laboratory is fully equipped with various instruments, glassware and chemicals for conducting experiments like Acid-Base Titrations, Complexometric Titrations, Colorimetry ,water analysis, pHmetry etc.

qa.question: What are some of the topics covered in the Chemistry Lab?
qa.answer: The Chemistry Lab has been set up to enable the students to acquire knowledge in the concepts of chemistry for engineering applications and to familiarize the students with different application oriented topics like new generation engineering materials, storage devices, different instrumental methods etc.

qa.question: How many teacher and student consoles are there in the language lab?
qa.answer: The language laboratory is well equipped with 64 teacher consoles and 1 teacher console.

qa.question: What software is used in the language lab?
qa.answer: The systems are installed with Orell Talk Language Lab Pro Version lab software.

qa.question: What does the language lab software facilitate?
qa.answer: It facilitates language acquisition via features like audio-visual content, group discussions, and real-time assessments.

What is the purpose of the ICC?
qa.answer: To deal with the complaints relating to Sexual Harassment at workplace.

qa.question: What regulations and acts is the ICC working in pursuance of?
qa.answer: UGC (Prevention, prohibition and redressal of sexual harassment of women employees and students in higher educational institutions) Regulations 2015 read with Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace (Prevention, Prohibition and Redressal) Act 2013 (SHWW Act 2013), and as per the AICTE Regulations.

qa.question: What does the ICC do when it receives a complaint?
qa.answer: ICC shall conduct preliminary enquiry so as to ascertain the truth of the allegations by collecting the documentary evidence and the recording statements of possible witnesses including the complainant. ICC shall then submit the preliminary enquiry report to the Principal along with all the original documents collected during the preliminary enquiry proceedings.

qa.question: Who can approach the ICC for help?
qa.answer: Any female (faculty, student or staff) of MBCET Thiruvananthapuram.

qa.question: To whom should I send an email if I am being harassed?
qa.answer: Inform the chairperson by email at [email protected]

qa.question: How long does the inquiry process take?
qa.answer: The inquiry shall be completed within a period of 90 days from the date of the complaint.

qa.question: How long does the employer have to act upon the ICC's recommendation?
qa.answer: The employer shall act upon the recommendation within 60 days of receiving it.

qa.question: Where can I find the UGC Regulations for Higher Educational Institutions?
